subject: JAM*Tester--tool for teachers
msgSnippet: Well, this is kind of a work in progress.  I guess I had better start with the story behind it.  My AP Computer Science teacher uses JUnit along with BlueJ to
messageBody:
Well, this is kind of a work in progress. I guess I had better
start with the story behind it. My AP Computer Science teacher uses
JUnit along with BlueJ to help him grade our labs. It makes it easy
for him to test all of the methods that each student has written for
the assignment. The problem, however, is that this was very time
consuming, as he has many students, and he had to compile and run
the tests on each student's code. Thus, he asked me to help him by
writing a program that would do it for him. Which is how JAM*Tester
came about. I'm still working on it, but it would be nice if a
couple of people could try it and let me know if it works.

The website is http://www.depoll.com Right now it only works on
Windows machines, but I'm working on it! Thanks for the interest!
Please e-mail me any suggestions you may have (check the contact
page on the website).

P.S. I guess I should say a little about myself. I'm a 16 year old
Junior at Troy High School (Class of '05). I love programming.
It's a lot of fun. This project gave me an opportunity to
experiment with some unfamiliar concepts. I hope you like it.
